Class EventsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.ajilore.code.ui.events.EventsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeneralEventsFragment
public abstract class EventsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
Base fragment displaying a list of events. Meant to be subclassed for specific event list screens. Handles event list loading, RecyclerView setup, and empty/progress views.

  • Method Details

    • getRowLayoutId

      @LayoutRes protected abstract int getRowLayoutId()
      Provides the layout resource ID for one row in the event list. Subclasses must supply a layout with correct binding IDs.
      Returns:
      Layout resource for an event row.

    • getEventsQuery

      protected abstract com.google.firebase.firestore.Query getEventsQuery()
      Supplies the Firestore query used to load events. Subclasses can control ordering and filtering.
      Returns:
      Firestore Query fetching events.

    • onEventClick

      protected abstract void onEventClick(@NonNull EventRow row)
      Handles the user tapping an event row in the list.
      Parameters:
      row - The EventRow that was clicked.

    • onCreateView

      public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, android.view.ViewGroup container, android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Inflates the event list fragment view.
      Overrides:
      onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      inflater - LayoutInflater for view creation.
      container - Parent ViewGroup, if any.
      savedInstanceState - Previously saved state, if any.
      Returns:
      The root view for this fragment.

    • onViewCreated

      public void onViewCreated(@NonNull android.view.View v, @Nullable android.os.Bundle s)
      Initializes RecyclerView, starts event loading, binds click handlers, and sets up progress/empty views.
      Overrides:
      onViewCreated in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      v - Root fragment view after inflation.
      s - Saved instance state, if any.
